Subjective: Headaches for 2 months, worsening. Right-sided, sometimes bilateral. Associated with nausea, no vomiting. Glare sensitivity. Prefers dark room. Family history: father with migraines, grandfather with cluster headaches. No trauma, no stress. Social: Student, non-smoker, occasional alcohol use. ICE: Worried about cause, wants diagnosis and treatment.
Objective: BP: 120/80. Pulse: 50/min. Neurological examination: cranial nerves intact, fingertip-nose test good, arm and leg strength good, Romberg's normal. Gait slightly off.
Assessment: Likely migraine. Ruled out: cluster headaches.
Plan: 1. Read about migraines on thuisarts.nl. 2. Start pain relief (paracetamol, ibuprofen) at symptom onset. 3. Keep headache diary to track patterns and triggers. 4. Follow-up in 4 weeks to evaluate progress and adjust plan as needed.
